Instructions

children.content: Keep scrolling down to get the instructions in text and photos. Or, watch the video below to see how I put together the triangle version of this planter:

content: Keep scrolling down to get the instructions in text and photos. Or, watch the video below to see how I put together the triangle version of this planter:

children.content: most of the way with moss. You'll want to save some moss to put on the top. Also make sure to leave some room to put the succulents inside.

content: Start by filling up the
planter
most of the way with moss. You'll want to save some moss to put on the top. Also make sure to leave some room to put the succulents inside.

attributes.value: redwood heart planter filled with moss
redwood heart planter filled with moss

children.content: Remove excess soil from the roots of the succulents. If the roots are tightly bound you'll want to loosen them up. This will enable the roots to spread more easily. Find out more about

content: Remove excess soil from the roots of the succulents. If the roots are tightly bound you'll want to loosen them up. This will enable the roots to spread more easily. Find out more about
why that's essential here

attributes.value: Succulents with most of the soil removed from the roots
Succulents with most of the soil removed from the roots

children.content: . Nestle the roots into the moss to help hold the succulent in place.

content: Start placing the
succulents in the planter
. Nestle the roots into the moss to help hold the succulent in place.

attributes.value: adding succulents to a redwood heart planter box
adding succulents to a redwood heart planter box

children.content: After you have all your succulents in place, make sure you like the way they are arranged and how close they are to each other. You can also add a little soil back in if there's a lot of empty space between plants.

content: After you have all your succulents in place, make sure you like the way they are arranged and how close they are to each other. You can also add a little soil back in if there's a lot of empty space between plants.

attributes.value: succulents filling up a redwood heart planter
succulents filling up a redwood heart planter

children.content: After you have the succulents situated, finish off the arrangement by adding moss in between the succulents. Be sure to cover up any visible roots or soil.

content: After you have the succulents situated, finish off the arrangement by adding moss in between the succulents. Be sure to cover up any visible roots or soil.

attributes.value: succulents and moss in a wood heart planter
succulents and moss in a wood heart planter

children.content: The arrangement should lay flat for at least 4-6 weeks until the roots have had time to grow into the moss.

content: The arrangement should lay flat for at least 4-6 weeks until the roots have had time to grow into the moss.

attributes.value: A wood heart shaped planter with succulents arranged inside
A wood heart shaped planter with succulents arranged inside

children.content: After a few weeks you can stand the
up, hang it on a wall, or keep it flat. It's up to you!

content: After a few weeks you can stand the
arrangement
up, hang it on a wall, or keep it flat. It's up to you!

content: Caring for the Arrangement

children.content: You can care for this gorgeous new arrangement the same as other succulents you own. If you don't own succulents yet, or these are your first, sign up for our
to learn the basics of succulent care.

content: You can care for this gorgeous new arrangement the same as other succulents you own. If you don't own succulents yet, or these are your first, sign up for our
free Succulents for Beginners course
to learn the basics of succulent care.

children.content: The course will help you make succulent growing easy, fun and stress-free… the way it should be!
